hints_html: Draw the phase space to see the slopes of the solution. Then draw the solution by starting at \((0,0)\) and following the slopes until you reach the equilibrium.
hints_latex:
Draw the phase space to see the slopes of the solution. Then draw the
solution by starting at $(0,0)$ and following the slopes until you reach
the equilibrium.
hints_raw:
Draw the phase space to see the slopes of the solution. 
Then draw the solution by starting at <math> \ (0,0) </math> and following the slopes until you reach the equilibrium.
question: C 04 (c)
sols_html:
We want to sketch the solution without solving the equation. Hence, we draw the phase space. Therefore, we first make a table with \(Q\) and the corresponding \(dQ/dt\).

[c]@llllll@ \(Q=0\) & \(Q=2\) & \(Q=4\) & \(Q=6\) & \(Q=8\) & \(Q=10\)
\(dQ/dt=5\) & \(dQ/dt=4\) & \(dQ/dt=3\) & \(dQ/dt=2\) & \(dQ/dt=1\) & \(dQ/dt=0\)

After drawing the phase space, the curve of the solution can be plotted by following the slopes.
sols_raw:
We want to sketch the solution without solving the equation. Hence, we draw the phase space. 
Therefore, we first make a table with <math>\ Q</math> and the corresponding <math>dQ/dt</math>.

{| class="wikitable"
|-
| <math>\ Q=0</math> || <math>\ Q=2</math> || <math>\ Q=4</math> || <math>\ Q=6</math> || <math>\ Q=8</math> || <math>\ Q=10</math>
|-
| <math>\ dQ/dt=5 </math> || <math>\ dQ/dt=4 </math> || <math>\ dQ/dt=3 </math> || <math>\ dQ/dt=2 </math> || <math>\ dQ/dt=1 </math> || <math>\ dQ/dt=0 </math>
|}


After drawing the phase space, the curve of the solution can be plotted by following the slopes.

[[File:MATH102_December_2012_Question_C_4_%28c%29_Image_1.png|500px]]
statement_html:
Dead leaves accumulate on the ground in a forest at a rate of 5 grams per square centimeter per year. At the same time, these leaves decompose at a continuous rate of 50 percent per year.

(c) Sketch the graph of the solution to your differential equation showing that the mass of dead leaves tends toward a steady state assuming that initially (t = 0) there are no leaves on the ground.
statement_latex:
Dead leaves accumulate on the ground in a forest at a rate of 5 grams
per square centimeter per year. At the same time, these leaves decompose
at a continuous rate of 50 percent per year.

(c) Sketch the graph of the solution to your differential equation
showing that the mass of dead leaves tends toward a steady state
assuming that initially (\emph{t = 0}) there are no leaves on the
ground.
statement_raw:
Dead leaves accumulate on the ground in a forest at a rate of 5 grams per square centimeter per year.  At the same time, these leaves decompose at a continuous rate of 50 percent per year.  

(c) Sketch the graph of the solution to your differential equation showing that the mass of dead leaves tends toward a steady state assuming that initially (''t = 0'') there are no leaves on the ground.
